document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Blastobasinae of Costa Rica (Lepidoptera: Gelechioidea: Blastobasidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Blastobasinae of Costa Rica (Lepidoptera: Gelechioidea: Blastobasidae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to the Species of
Blastobasis
of Costa Rica

paragraph.keyLead:
- Sockets of tergal setae not extending beyond midlength of tegumen (
Figs. 77
, 95 ); sclerite of phallus sigmoid-shaped or nearly so (
Figs. 78
, 96 )..................................................................................... 4

6 . Digital process of dorsal part of valva recurved apically (
Fig. 123
)..............................
Blastobasis phaedra

- Digital process of dorsal part of valva not recurved apically (
Figs. 109
, 133 )..................................... 7

9 . Length of pigmented part of gnathos at least
3 X
longer than width ( Figs. 99 , 113 , 212 , 129 )......................... 10

- Length of pigmented part of gnathos less than
3 X
width (
Figs. 67
, 73 ,
83 , 91
, 93 , 101 , 115 , 125 )..................... 13

- Area beneath costa of dorsal part of valva densely microtrichiate ( Figs. 99 , 113 , 121 ); sclerite of phallus not acutely curved from midlength ( Figs. 100 , 114 , 122 )..................................................................... 11

11 . Anellus broadly rounded apically (
Fig. 114
)............................................
Blastobasis deliciolarum

12 . Base of sclerite of phallus straight; anellus broadly notched apically (
Fig. 100
)......................
Blastobasis echus

- Base of sclerite of phallus curved; anellus narrowly notched apically (
Fig. 122
).......................
Blastobasis nivis

13 . Sockets of tergal setae extending beyond midlength of tegumen (
Figs. 91
, 93 , 101 , 115 )........................... 14

- Sockets of tergal setae not extending beyond midlength of tegumen (
Figs. 67
, 73 ,
83 , 125
)......................... 17

14 . Base of sclerite of phallus straight; anellus broadly rounded apically (
Fig. 92
)......................
Blastobasis orithyia
- Base of sclerite of phallus curved; anellus not broadly rounded apically ( Figs. 94 , 102 , 116 )........................ 15

15 . Digitate process of valva lobelike (
Fig. 115
); basal width of anellus
3 X
width of apex (
Fig. 116
).......
Blastobasis abollae

- Digitate process of valva not lobelike (
Figs. 93
, 101 ); basal width of anellus less than
3 X
of apical width (
Figs. 74
, 102 ).. 16

20 . Width of pigmented part of gnathos longer than its length (
Figs. 85
, 97 , 105 , 127 )................................ 21
21 . Sockets of tergal setae extending beyond midlength of tegumen ( Figs. 85 , 105 , 127 ).............................. 22

- Sockets of tergal setae not extending beyond midlength of tegumen (
Fig. 97
).......................
Blastobasis usurae

22 . Pigmented part of gnathos
2 X
wider than long (
Fig. 127
); anellus with a pair of recurved apical barblike processes (
Fig. 128
)......................................................................................
Blastobasis tapetae

- Pigmented part of anellus not
2 X
wider than long (
Figs. 85
, 105 )............................................. 23

24 . Sockets of tergal setae extending beyond midlength of tegumen (
Figs. 65
, 69 ,
75 , 81
)............................. 25

- Sockets of tergal setae not extending beyond midlength of tegumen (
Figs. 71
, 79 ,
87, 89
, 103 , 107 , 117, 119 , 131 , 135 ).. 28

- Lateral margin of proximal flange of valva broadly rounded (
Figs. 65
, 75 ,
81
)................................... 26

- Dorsal strut of tegumen absent (
Figs. 75
, 81 ); anellus not constricted basally (
Figs. 76
, 82 )......................... 27

31 . Anellus about 1 / 2 length of phallus; anellus apically narrowed (
Fig. 118
).............................
Blastobasis lex

32 . Proximal flange of valva
2 X
wider apically than basally (
Fig. 89
)................................
Blastobasis achaea

- Proximal flange of valva only slightly wider apically than basally (
Fig. 87
)........................
Blastobasis neniae

35 . Uncus
4 X
longer than wide, parallelsided; proximal flange densely microtrichiate (
Fig. 79
).............
Blastobasis erae

- Uncus less than
3 X
longer than wide, narrowed from base (
Figs. 103
, 107 ); proximal flange not densely microtrichiate (
Figs. 103
, 107 ).......................................................................................... 36

39 . Internal platelets within anterior 2 / 3 of ductus bursae (
Fig. 253
).................................
Blastobasis caetrae

40 . Internal platelets within anterior 1 / 3 of ductus bursae (
Fig. 256
).................................
Blastobasis iuanae

- Internal platelets within anterior 1 / 4 of ductus bursae (
Fig. 254
)................................
Blastobasis furtivus

41 . Antrum wider than long; signum spinate (
Fig. 257
).........................................
Blastobasis graminea

- Antrum not present; signum short, conical (
Fig. 258
)........................................
Blastobasis coffeaella

- Posterior margin of seventh sternum laterally emarginate (
Figs. 252
, 255 )...................................... 44

43 . Inception of ductus seminalis slightly anterior to posterior margin of seventh sternum (
Fig. 259
).........
Blastobasis vesta

- Inception of ductus seminalis midway between posterior and anterior margin of seventh sternum (
Fig. 260
)....................................................................................................
Blastobasis dicionis

44 . Antrum wider than long; signum spinate (
Fig. 252
)...........................................
Blastobasis balucis

- Antrum not present; signum short, conical (
Fig. 255
)............................................
Blastobasis deae
